snippet: Newly declassified documents show disagreement among judges on the secret surveillance court, and the Bush administration pushing forward with “innovative” solutions.
abstract: Newly declassified documents show disagreement among judges on Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Court, and Bush administration pushing forward with wiretapping phone and email program.
lead_paragraph: Newly declassified documents show disagreement among judges on the secret surveillance court, and the Bush administration pushing forward with “innovative” solutions.

headline.main: Documents Shed New Light on Legal Wrangling Over Spying in U.S.
headline.print_headline: Documents Shed New Light on Legal Wrangling Over Spying in U.S.

keywords.value: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods
